articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A vessel that was approaching Freedom Flotilla Coalition's Gaza-bound charity ship the Madleen has left, the coalition said early on Monday, after an alarm was sounded on the ship warning of a possible interception.
articles.title: Freedom Flotilla Coalition says vessel approaching Gaza-bound ship left

articles.author: Aleksandar Vasovic
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine carried out an exchange of prisoners of war on Monday involving POWs under the age of 25 and others who had been severely wounded, the start of what could become the biggest swap of the war so far.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine exchange group of younger and wounded prisoners of war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police declared all of downtown Los Angeles to be an unlawful assembly area and ordered protesters to go home after a third day of violence hit demonstrations against President Donald Trump's immigration policy.
articles.title: Los Angeles police order immigration protesters in downtown to go home

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations said on Monday that it has only been able to bring minimal flour into Gaza since Israel lifted an aid blockade three weeks ago and that has mostly been looted by armed gangs or taken by starving Palestinians.
articles.title: UN says most flour delivered in Gaza looted or taken by starving people

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A U.S. judge on Monday dismissed actor Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuit against actress Blake Lively, who had accused Baldoni of sexually harassing her while filming the 2024 movie "It Ends With Us."
articles.title: Judge dismisses Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuit against Blake Lively

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sly Stone, the driving force behind Sly and the Family Stone, a multiracial American band whose boiling mix of rock, soul and psychedelia embodied 1960s idealism and helped popularize funk music, has died at the age of 82, his family said on Monday.
articles.title: Sly Stone, leader of 1960s funk band, dies at age 82

articles.author: Kate Holton, Dan Burns
articles.description: Top U.S. and Chinese officials were due to meet in London on Monday for talks aimed at defusing the high-stakes trade dispute that has widened in recent weeks beyond tit-for-tat tariffs to export controls over goods critical to global supply chains.
articles.title: US and Chinese officials to meet in London for pivotal trade talks

articles.author: Ted Hesson, Tim Reid, Mike Scarcella
articles.description: Images of federal immigration agents wearing masks and balaclavas as they conduct raids in Los Angeles and other U.S. cities have ignited a politically charged debate over whether they are protecting their identities or engaging in intimidation tactics.
articles.title: Los Angeles ICE raids fuel controversy over masked agents

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The U.S. State Department directed all U.S. missions abroad and consular sections to resume processing Harvard University student and exchange visitor visas after a federal judge in Boston last week temporarily blocked President Donald Trump's ban on foreign students at the Ivy-League institution.
articles.title: US State Dept resumes processing Harvard student visas after judge's ruling

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Public disorder broke out in Ballymena town centre in Northern Ireland following a protest reportedly over an alleged sexual assault case on Monday, with police saying a number of missiles had been thrown towards officers.
articles.title: Public disorder breaks out in Northern Irish town, with missiles thrown at police
